item.description:
Finally, winter is here in the Whites.  Time to break out those ice tools, and get some top rope ice climbing.  By popular demand, we will be climbing something in Crawford Notch, e.g., Willy's Slide, or Lost in the Forest (TR).

The plan is to meet up in the parking lot at 8 AM, Jan 8.  We will then walk up the hill (or drive and park) then head out to Lost in the Forest.  That will be north along the railroad tracks, then just after the bridge, up the hill.

Later on, if a group wants, some can go to Willy's in the afternoon.

You must have double boots, crampons, harness, locking biner+belay device, helmet, balaclava, two or more pairs of gloves (they get wet), water proof (eg, Gore-Tex) tops and bottoms, and of course, warm fleece layers. If you have ice tools, ropes, biners, screws, anchor material, bring those too.  If you want to climb Willy's, you will need tools.

For more information, check out the FAQ's on ice climbing.

For weather, Accuweather, Mount Washington Observatory

Current ice climbing conditions: neice.com, neclimbs.com
item.name: Ice climbing in the Whites
